```{python}
import pandas as pd 
import numpy as np

Ames = pd.read_csv("/Users/benrobinson/Desktop/GSB 544 ML/DATA/AmesHousing.csv")
```


```{python}
# --- Imports used in the chapter style ---
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
import numpy as np

# --- Data split (do this ONCE) ---
# Use only the columns needed across the four models
X = Ames[["Gr Liv Area", "TotRms AbvGrd", "Bldg Type"]]
y = Ames["SalePrice"]
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, random_state=42)

def rmse(y_true, y_pred):
    return np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_true, y_pred))

```


# Model 1: size + number of rooms (numeric only, scaled)

```{python}
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

ct1 = ColumnTransformer(
    [
        ("num_scale", StandardScaler(), ["Gr Liv Area", "TotRms AbvGrd"])
    ],
    remainder="drop"
)

pipe1 = Pipeline([
    ("pre", ct1),
    ("linreg", LinearRegression())
]).set_output(transform="pandas")

pipe1.fit(X_train, y_train)
pred1 = pipe1.predict(X_test)
rmse1 = rmse(y_test, pred1)
rmse1
```


# Model 2: size + rooms + building type (OHE for categorical)

```{python}
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression


ct2 = ColumnTransformer(
    [
        ("num_scale", StandardScaler(), ["Gr Liv Area", "TotRms AbvGrd"]),
        ("cat_ohe", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", sparse_output=False), ["Bldg Type"])
    ],
    remainder="drop"
)

pipe2 = Pipeline([
    ("pre", ct2),
    ("linreg", LinearRegression())
]).set_output(transform="pandas")   # OK now because OHE is dense

pipe2.fit(X_train, y_train)
pred2 = pipe2.predict(X_test)
rmse2 = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_test, pred2))
rmse2
```


```{python}
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Model 3: size + building type + their interaction
# (rooms excluded; create interaction terms between size and Bldg Type)
# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
ct3 = ColumnTransformer(
    [
        ("size_scale", StandardScaler(), ["Gr Liv Area"]),
        ("cat_ohe",    OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", sparse_output=False), ["Bldg Type"])
    ],
    remainder="drop"
)

pipe3 = Pipeline([
    ("pre", ct3),
    ("interaction", PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, interaction_only=True, include_bias=False)),
    ("linreg", LinearRegression())
]).set_output(transform="pandas")

pipe3.fit(X_train, y_train)
pred3 = pipe3.predict(X_test)
rmse3 = rmse(y_test, pred3)
rmse3
```


```{python}
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Model 4: poly(5) on size, poly(5) on rooms, + building type (no size√órooms cross-terms)
# (do separate mini-pipelines so each numeric gets its own 5th-degree expansion)
# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
num_size = Pipeline([
    ("scale", StandardScaler()),
    ("poly",  PolynomialFeatures(degree=5, include_bias=False))
])

num_rooms = Pipeline([
    ("scale", StandardScaler()),
    ("poly",  PolynomialFeatures(degree=5, include_bias=False))
])

ct4 = ColumnTransformer(
    [
        ("size_poly5",  num_size,  ["Gr Liv Area"]),
        ("rooms_poly5", num_rooms, ["TotRms AbvGrd"]),
        ("cat_ohe",     OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", sparse_output=False), ["Bldg Type"])
    ],
    remainder="drop"
)

pipe4 = Pipeline([
    ("pre", ct4),
    ("linreg", LinearRegression())
]).set_output(transform="pandas")

pipe4.fit(X_train, y_train)
pred4 = pipe4.predict(X_test)
rmse4 = rmse(y_test, pred4)
rmse4
```


Model 3 has the lowest MSE!
